intro: Urera madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar urera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, although it is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
